page.title: 16Ravensburgh Castle
page.content: {Ravensburgh Hillfort}is found at (29,10). It was built on top of a hill {154 m high}which is steepest on the southern side and was built more than {2000 years ago.}Probably all the people in our area lived there because its steep sides made it easy to protect. Ravensburgh was constructed by digging ditches round the hill with antlers and stone tools. Excavated earth was piled up to make high walls. A strong wooden fence was built at the top{enclosing about 20 acres.}The huts inside were made from mud, stones and thatch. Today it has not changed greatly. The remains of the ditches are still there but the hill is covered in trees and brambles. You may only visit at certain times and with permission of Mr Ashley Cooper who owns the land now and uses it for pheasant breeding and forestry.
